title: Zharnel Hughes runs 9.83 to break Linford Christie's long-standing British men's 100m record
description: Zharnel Hughes breaks Linford Christie's British men's 100m record, which had stood for 30 years, by clocking 9.83 seconds in New York.

title: Glastonbury: Watch Lizzo, Lewis Capaldi and Rick Astley perform
description: Lizzo, Lewis Capaldi and Rick Astley have all taken to the stage at Worthy Farm.

title: The Ashes 2023: England's Tammy Beaumont revels in 'special' double century
description: Tammy Beaumont says scoring England women's first double century was "pretty special" as it was against the "best team in the world".

title: Super League: Catalans Dragons 38-30 Leigh Leopards
description: Super League leaders Catalans Dragons overcome fellow high-flyers Leigh in a thriller to move two points clear at the summit.

title: Lewis Capaldi struggles to finish Glastonbury set
description: After suffering vocal problems, the Scottish star suggests he might have to take an extended break.

title: Women's Ashes 2023: Australia in control after Tammy Beaumont breaks England record - highlights
description: Watch highlights as Australian openers Beth Mooney and Phoebe Litchfield give their side the advantage after Tammy Beaumont hit a record-breaking double century on day three of the Women's Ashes Test at Trent Bridge.

title: Royal Ascot: 80-1 Khaadem claims shock win in Queen Elizabeth II Jubilee Stakes
description: Jamie Spencer rides 80-1 shot Khaadem to victory in the Queen Elizabeth II Jubilee Stakes at Royal Ascot - the biggest price winner in the race's history.

title: The Ashes 2023: England's Tammy Beaumont hits 208 but Australia build lead in one-off Test
description: Australia take control of the one-off Ashes Test at Trent Bridge despite Tammy Beaumont's record-breaking 208 for England.

title: Cedric Roussel: Ex-Coventry and Wolves striker dies aged 45
description: Former Belgium, Coventry and Wolves striker Cedric Roussel dies aged 45.

title: Gloucester-Hartpury 34-19 Exeter Chiefs: Cherry and Whites win Premier 15s at 'Queensholm'
description: Gloucester-Hartpury beat Exeter Chiefs in a hard-fought final at 'Queensholm' Stadium to become Premier 15s champions for the first time.

title: Former Team GB Olympian Andy Butchart breaks Parkrun record
description: Scotland's Andy Butchart, 31, finished a 5k in Silverknowes, Edinburgh in a blistering 13:45.

title: Tributes to Carlisle footballer who died in Ibiza fall
description: John McKenna, who played for Scotby FC, died after apparently falling from his hotel balcony.

title: Women's Ashes 2023: Tammy Beaumont breaks record for highest England women's Test score
description: Watch the moment Tammy Beaumont moves to 192 runs to break Betty Snowball's 88-year-old record of 189 for the highest Test score by an English woman on day three of the Women's Ashes Test at Trent Bridge.

title: Polar Prince: Support ship docks at Canadian harbour as rescue operations wind down
description: Canadian investigators in Newfoundland are examining the main support ship after sub's implosion.

title: Queen's 2023 results: Alex de Minaur beats Holger Rune to reach final
description: Australian Alex de Minaur reaches his first Queen's final with a straight-set win over Danish second seed Holger Rune.

title: Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe: 'Readjusting to UK life was hard'
description: The British-Iranian national says civil unrest in Iran has made readjusting to the UK difficult.

title: Margaret McDonagh, key New Labour figure, dies aged 61
description: She was the first female general secretary of the party and played a major role in two election wins.

title: Rishi Sunak's concern over volatile Russia situation
description: The UK prime minister is watching events closely, as the government holds an emergency planning meeting.

title: Prigozhin: The day Wagner chief went rogue in 83 seconds
description: Yevgeny Prigozhin has called for a rebellion against the Russian military and entered Rostov-on-Don.

title: Rick Astley doesn't let Glastonbury down
description: The pop star draws a huge crowd to the Pyramid Stage, for a midday singalong to his greatest hits.

title: Yevgeny Prigozhin: From hot dog seller to Wagner boss
description: The BBC's Ros Atkins looks at Yevgeny Prigozhin's unusual rise through the military ranks.

title: Sierra Leone election: Tense poll amid fears of violence
description: The president and diplomats have called for calm amid a rise in violent incidents in the vote's run-up.

title: Women's Ashes 2023: First-ball drama as Natalie Sciver-Brunt survives wicket after review
description: Watch as Natalie Sciver-Brunt is given out with the first ball of day three but survives after a successful review.

title: South East Water blames working from home for hosepipe ban
description: South East Water claims shortages are partly down to more people working from home.

title: BBC shows Rick Astley round at his first Glastonbury
description: Colin Paterson gives the star a whistle-stop tour of the site ahead of his set on the Pyramid Stage.

title: Analysis: Putin under pressure as ally turns rebel
description: The Russian leader vowed to punish Yevgeny Prigozhin after his Wagner forces seized a key Russian city.

title: Comments on Kyrgios 'misinterpreted' as racist - Tsitsipas
description: Stefanos Tsitsipas says comments he made towards Nick Kyrgios at Wimbledon in 2022 have been "misinterpreted" after they were perceived as racist on social media.

title: Is this a coup? What is Prigozhin doing in Russia?
description: The mercenary boss has openly challenged the military leadership in a defining moment for Russians.

title: Wagner chief Yevgeny Prigozhin claims control of major Russian city Rostov-on-Don
description: Yevgeny Prigozhin claims his Wagner forces have seized "all military facilities" in Rostov-on-Don.

title: Putin: These actions 'a knife in the back of our people'
description: President Putin addresses the nation for the first time since reports of a coup as the Wagner boss vows to topple Russian military leaders.

title: Vaping: E-cigarettes have ruined my life, woman says
description: Belle Moore, 19, who started vaping at 16 years old says she feels like she has "no control over it".

title: Parents appeal for help to find son's killer
description: Adam Chadwick's parents are still none the wiser on why their son was gunned down 15 years ago.

title: Obey will of Putin and return to base - Top Russian commander
description: General Sergei Surovikin urges Wagner fighters to obey the will of President Putin.

title: Puffin Rock is a 'once in a lifetime opportunity' for Beth McCafferty
description: Beth McCafferty, 14, voices the hero of the first animated movie produced in Northern Ireland.

title: Women's PGA Championship: Leona Maguire leads by one shot at halfway
description: Ireland's Leona Maguire hits a flurry of late birdies to take the halfway lead at the Women's PGA Championship in New Jersey.

title: Irish dancer kicks her last can-can at Moulin Rouge
description: Claudine Van Den Bergh Cooke, from Dublin, is hanging up her headdress to become a solicitor.

title: Women's Ashes 2023: England's Tammy Beaumont should target double century - analysis
description: Ex-England spinner Alex Hartley says Tammy Beaumont should set her sights on a double century as England look to get close to Australia's score of 473 in the Test at Trent Bridge.

title: Four ways the end of Roe v Wade has changed America
description: After a Supreme Court ruling, many states banned abortion - but now more Americans want it kept legal.

title: Arctic Monkeys at Glastonbury: A tale of two halves
description: The rock band battle through illness to play their headline slot, but the set divides the audience.

title: Sudan conflict: Army outnumbered on Khartoum's streets
description: Rival forces have a stronger presence in the capital, despite the fact that the army is much bigger.

title: Migrant deaths: 'I saw the boat sink under my feet'
description: A survivor of two boat sinkings tells his story in the deadliest year for migrants in the Americas.

title: Households to be spared net zero levy, says Shapps
description: Steps to fund the UK's hydrogen industry will not be tied to energy bills, the Energy Security Minister says.
